Courtney R Armour

title: Courtney R Armour PhD
text: I’m a computational biologist specializing in statistical analysis of complex datasets. I am experienced with multiple programing languages as well as a variety of data exploration and visualization techniques. I’m passionate about open science and reproducible research. I’m seeking the opportunity to work on cutting edge research at the frontier of human health.

title: Courtney R. Armour PhD
text:
Research Experience






Dates


Position


Lab


Projects






2020-present


Postdoctoral Research Fellow (remote)


Schloss LabDepartment of Microbiology and ImmunologyUniveristy of Michigan



Optimizing machine learning models to predict colorectal cancer based on gut microbiome taxonomic abundace
Identifying early markers of colorectal cancer development in a large clinical cohort of individuals with genetic predisposition to cancer
Developing curriculum and teaching computational skills to coding beginners in virtual workshops





2014-2020


Graduate Research Assistant


Sharpton LabDepartment of MicrobiologyOregon State University



Metagenomic analysis of gut microbiom samples to quantify associations with health
Assembly of metagenomic data from gut microbiome samples to build integrated gene catalogues of microbiome genomic diversity
Collaborate with a diverse group to develop methodology for analyzing analyzing microbiome data





2010-2013


Research/Laboratory Assistant


Dr. Paul Boehmer and Dr. Jui-Cheng HsiehDepartment of Basic Medical SciencesUniversity of Arizona



Creation of HSV-1 viral mutants to quantify impact on replication
Mentor new members of the lab
Maintain tissue culture and order supplies

title: courtneyarmour.github.io
text:
Summary
I’m a computational biologist specializing in statistical analysis of complex datasets. I am experienced with multiple programming languages as well as a variety of data exploration and visualization techniques. I’m passionate about open science and reproducible research. I’m seeking the opportunity to work on cutting edge research at the frontier of human health.
